title: Globalink Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mitacs
Interview Descriptions: Professor emailed me and I joined the meeting and then my interview lasted for 30 minutes and the professor told that I am a potential candidate for the project. And I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Questions were mostly on why do you want to consider this project, what prior experience you have related to project.

title: Intern Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were decent. Asked about my research projects and academics. Everthing was asked out of my CV. It is good to read up about the project you are applying to beforehand.
Interview Questions: Your Research Projects Interest in project

title: Research Student Interview
Interview Descriptions: The professor takes a basic CV Walkthrough along with a personality check. After that, the professor shows some presentation and asks if I have any questions from him. I think this was his way of judging how curious I'm about the project.
Interview Questions: Q: Do you know how do motor proteins affect the delivery of information?

title: Researcher Interview
Interview Descriptions:
1. Resume based shortlisting?
2. Matchmaking with professors and projects.
3. Interviews with chosen professors.
4. Some might get an interview call and some might get direct selection or rejection.
5. high cpi matters
46. check compatibility with research group.
6, 3 months intern.

title: Internship Interview
Interview Descriptions: Started with formal introduction like name and family background and project description followed with previous projects done . The interviwer then asked some concept related to project, what is the roadmap or idea on accomplishment of the project

title: Summer Research Intern Interview
Interview Descriptions:
All about personality and background.
Only one round of interview. 
Sometimes professors may give tasks to qualify for further interviews.

Prepare all the skills required for the project and the university.

Hiring process is very selective

title: Research Intern Interview
Interview Descriptions: The process was very smooth. The professors really cared about the students and made them comfortable in the interview by asking general questions first and then moving on to questions related to skills, past experiences and expectations from the program.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your past internship experiences.

title: Summer Research Internship Interview
Interview Descriptions: Firstly we have to complete a long application online. In which the data required is 2 LOR's, a transcript, and your CV along with a concise 100 words essay. Then once your application is shortlisted your profile will be shared with professors. If any Professor is interested in your application he/she can ask you for a short introductory virtual interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this internship?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Mitacs (Hyderābād) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was very easy, it focused on your resume and the topics related to the projects you have done in the past. 
They just want to know if you are a good fit for the project and want to check if you're capable.
Interview Questions: Explain your work in your projects?

title: Visiting Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mitacs (Dhanbād) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was one to one and was done on skype. Professor asked questions about Indian crude oil. Interview lasted for about half an hour. Overall they wanted to assess about the technical background and personality. Last but not the least, we also talked about working culture and climate since this opportunity can only availed in Canada.
Interview Questions: Will you able to work in entirely different ambience

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mitacs (Vadodara) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the Globalink program for an undergraduate internship.  The process was very smooth and MITACS arranged for interactions between the professors and students very efficiently.  They were very helpful as well as prompt while solving any doubts I had about the selection process or the interview. The interview was conducted online through skype and lasted around 40 minutes. It was formal yet didn't make me feel nervous though it was my first interview. It was like a conversation where I and my professor were trying to get to know each other.
Interview Questions: The interview mainly revolved around what I had written in my CV, my prior research experiences and what I wish to do in the future. Some questions were technical while some were to analyze my communication skills.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mitacs (Coimbatore) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: was easy and core skillset was questioned. domain experience can help you ace it. he seniors there were so helpful. They taught me about my work and also about the field I was going to work in. I got to know a lot from them. I learned how we can use different social media platforms to tell people about our business and our work. I learned how youtube, facebook, twitter and instagram can be used to grow a business. I also learned some important things like data analysis. At first I thought why is data analysis so important but now I know that we need to keep records and improve ourselves. I also got to know that the world out there does not work how we think of it to be working.
Interview Questions: motivation for applying, definition of basics engineering terms

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mitacs in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It consisted of two rounds. The first one was a problem solving round. The other one was to mostly discuss the projects mentioned in my curriculum vitae. The Professor was very encouraging and helpful. Overall, it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Some algorithmic problems related to graphs.

title: Summer Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mitacs in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty simple. Just the knowledge of your previous work and resume are put to test. You should have a deep understanding of what all you have written in your resume.
Interview Questions:
Why did you choose this project?
What all courses have you undertaken ?
What is your previous research experience?
and then it is more specific for the project that you apply to.

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mitacs
Interview Descriptions:
It was good, all things went awesome.
Interview process was good.
Excellent person who took the interview.
He made me comfortable
And explained about the company
It was a good interactive session.
Overall a very nice experience.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mitacs in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It went well. Seemed positive. The PI mainly asked questions on motivation, programming,  and the course structure of my degree. He also made few points on accommodation and climate, and seemed quite friendly.

title: Globalink Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mitacs (Kharagpur, West Bengal) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Hiring process is very long. I sent my application is october and the results came out in around January. The process is time consuming and most of the time you can't really predict if they will move forward with you. That being said its probably because they get thousands of applications and handling all of that carefully is not an easy task.
Interview Questions: The questions were very generic and were mostly about my interest in the project and my own background. The professors were extreemly nice and gave me a good idea about what they wanted to know.
